section: Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are not subject to any delay.
explanation: This clause creates an inconsistency. While Company guarantees delivery within the specified timeframe (12 weeks), this clause stating due dates are 'not subject to any delay' is unrealistic and contradictory. Unforeseen circumstances (illness, technical issues, etc.) could reasonably cause delays. It is incongruent with standard business practices.

section: Payment Terms. Upon the signing of this Agreement, Client agrees to pay to Company a total of $5,000. Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work.
explanation: This section is ambiguous. 'Completion of the Scope of Work' is vague. It's unclear what constitutes 'completion'. Does it mean the delivery of the website, its full functionality, client approval, or something else? This lack of clarity could lead to disputes over when the final payment is due.

section: Client may be asked to pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work may be different from the standard hourly rate.
explanation: This section sets the condition to pay an additional surcharge when failing to meet scheduled times for delivery of information. But there is no documentation detailing what the scheduled times for delivery are, as it has not been defined. Thus, this poses as an ambiguity.
